intro: Masdevallia colossus, commonly known as the giant masdevallia, is a striking orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 inches in diameter, making it one of the largest orchids in the genus. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded forest environments. Its vibrant colors, often in shades of red, orange, and yellow, make it a prized specimen among orchid enthusiasts. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and challenging plant to cultivate.
